website_summaries.verdict: An impressively versatile compact drill driver that comes with a case, a battery, a charger, a handful of bits, and is affordably priced.
pros: This smaller sized unit is ideal for working in tight places and the fade-free power delivered by the lithium ion battery is appreciated
Drill mode allows you to fine tune the proper torque to the job
cons: This compact drill is powerful, but it does not have the torque of larger, heavier models

customer_reviews.title: I like the smaller form factor than the higher voltage models
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 3 of these over the last few years--one for me and each of my sons. Each one is a different version as Hitachi has been changing the specs. We haven't run them hard enough to tell the difference. I like the smaller form factor than the higher voltage models. I like the feel of the Hitachi much more than other 12V models I've looked at. I've had good luck with a charge lasting a reasonable time. And it has plenty of power for around the house projects. I also use mine extensively in my woodworking hobby. Overall this is great tool for around the house.
customer_reviews.author: MFA

customer_reviews.title: Overall - pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: It has worked very well for 5 years now, and it's very lightweight and ergonomic. The batteries have also kept up, and still hold a charge for several hours of assembly (I assemble grills & furniture for a living). My only caveat is that the black rubber trim along the handle has been (for some time now) coming loose, and the stretching and deforming makes it hard to re-attach with adhesive. Kind of annoying, but - other than that - a pretty decent screwgun for the price.
customer_reviews.author: B. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.  Compatible with Hitachi 12v

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the tendons & ligaments
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, plenty of torque for small jobs. Easy on the tendons & ligaments. Lithium batteries have some quirks: when they lose a charge, it is all at once, with basically no warning; so keep a backup charged & ready. Also if your battery is dormant too long, it can exhaust the life of the battery. So keep it charged. Another high quality Hitachi product.

customer_reviews.title: batteries were a huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The drill driver itself is great. Sturdy, well made, what I expect of a premium tool. However the LI-Ion battery packs were high maintenance, especially for infrequent use. I left one in the case and one continuously on the charger, and after a year neither one will hold a charge. A hundred-dollar paperweight. I am so disappointed. My mistake, I have been biased against cordless tools and I shouldn’t have caved. Never again.
